p: Therefore, for Nigeria to build back better after COVID-19 considering ongoing recovery efforts and getting a handle on the harmful effects of climate change, there is a need to learn from the shock and address the systemic gaps and risks revealed by the pandemic. The same applies to the impact of climate change. Significantly, this will provide the insights required to enhance preparedness actions on the part of the government and other stakeholders. This will also provide a buffer for better response and recovery planning based on historical evidence and ensure more resilient fiscal policies to reduce economic shocks and losses.
